alright I'm a super stoked to be here

as an organization and even as a

we are technically three years old we

small group of people that had a great

practices would look like and it's just

bringing kubernetes and forming C and C
F and mostly you know some of the just
the new folks in this room that have

forward to Keene continuing to you know
serve you all and and grow the community
so so thank you so moving on to the
awards I think one of the most important
things a open-source community could do
is recognize individuals that go above
and beyond their normal job duties to
benefit the community and I think one of
the most important you know principles
or values that we have in the cloud
native CN CF community is this concept
of chopping wood and carrying water I
think this concept was popularized by
Sarah and Botany especially in the
kubernetes community but for those
are not familiar with the concept this
is essentially working on all those you
know non-glamorous taught you know tasks
that are that are super critical to the
functioning of a project you know not
just flashy feature work but things like
you know security were you know hosting
events going after a technical debt and
so on and so last year we created this
award to kind of reflect this value
within our community and gave it out for
the first time and and this year will be
the second time we're giving it out and
so you know we asked our lovely growing
community to nominate individuals that
embody this value for the work that
they've done across cnc of projects and
you know i'm happy to announce today
that there are 14 individuals that have
been nominated for this award and i
would like to invite them all onstage so
Jim's Diane Mueller Christoph Blocher
Nikita Harris Pittman Richard Hartman
